metadata.Title: CVE-2015-6774 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the GetLoadTimes function in renderer/loadtimes_extension_bindings.cc in the Extensions implementation in Google Chrome before 47.0.2526.73 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted JavaScript code that modifies a pointer used for reporting loadTimes data.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6774` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu1.1218
chromium-browser-l10n - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu1.1218
chromium-chromedriver - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu1.1218
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu1.1218
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu1.1218
No subscription required

notes.Note: mikesalvatore> The Ubuntu Security Team does not support libv8

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu1.1218').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
